SENT.plain: Seven patients, presenting severe neurological status (grades IV and V according to Hunt and Hess) and cerebral vasospasm following subarachnoid haemorrhage were submitted to continuous ICP recording the study of the cerebral elastic properties by PVI compliance computation
All the patients presented low ICP values (below 20 mmHg) for the whole period of monitoring
The results of PVI and compliance measurements show that the pressure-volume curves in these patients are different from the physiological P-V curve
The PVI values progressively increase with the rise in ICP
The significance of this finding is discussed
